name: A Different Point of View
description:
by rumantra

"I was diagnosed with light schizophrenia in my early 20s, I was helping my friend who studies psychology and needed a person to be her subject on the roscha test. It was a set of cards with an abstract pattern in the middle made of pressed ink. I managed to identify 250+ images from those abstracts ink patterns while other test subjects only identify 20 - 30 images. An initial sign of the light schizophrenic mind.

Since then I learned more about this mental health 'issue' and it explains many things about myself. 

Sometimes I see the world in a very different view, sometimes the world is much more interesting in my head, sometimes the world in my head is a little bit too real and sometimes my head is much more alive than my body when it mixes with emotions.

I believe this condition is a blessing in disguise that helps me think differently and channel it thru the art that I create."
